chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold.
items.plainText: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold.

items.text: The rich and poor meet together: the LORD is the maker of them all.
items.plainText: The rich and poor meet together: the LORD is the maker of them all.

items.text: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.
items.plainText: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.

items.text: By humility and the fear of the LORD are riches, and honour, and life.
items.plainText: By humility and the fear of the LORD are riches, and honour, and life.

items.text: Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.
items.plainText: Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.

items.text: Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.
items.plainText: Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.

items.text: The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.
items.plainText: The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.

items.text: He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.
items.plainText: He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.

items.text: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.
items.plainText: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.

items.text: Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.
items.plainText: Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.

items.text: He that loveth pureness of heart, for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend.
items.plainText: He that loveth pureness of heart, for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend.

items.text: The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.
items.plainText: The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.

items.text: The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.
items.plainText: The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.

items.text: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the LORD shall fall therein.
items.plainText: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the LORD shall fall therein.

items.text: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
items.plainText: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.

items.text: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want.
items.plainText: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want.

items.text: Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.
items.plainText: Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.

items.text: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.
items.plainText: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.

items.text: That thy trust may be in the LORD, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.
items.plainText: That thy trust may be in the LORD, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.

items.text: Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,
items.plainText: Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,

items.text: That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?
items.plainText: That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?

items.text: Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:
items.plainText: Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:

items.text: For the LORD will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.
items.plainText: For the LORD will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.

items.text: Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:
items.plainText: Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:

items.text: Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.
items.plainText: Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.

items.text: Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.
items.plainText: Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.

items.text: If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?
items.plainText: If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?

items.text: Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.
items.plainText: Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.

items.text: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.
items.plainText: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.
